image.altText: Shannon Fentiman is challenging Steven Miles for Queensland's top job.

props.synopsis: Deputy Premier Steven Miles has thrown his hat in the ring to succeed Annastacia Palaszczuk as Queensland premier – but he is facing a challenge in his bid to take up the state's top job.

title.children: Palaszczuk's resignation turns into contested leadership battle as health minister challenges deputy premier for top job

image.altText: A middle-aged man stands in profile with a security on his left.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian MPs returning to parliament tomorrow to consider a move to suspend a judge facing criminal charges are told they may not have the necessary powers to do so.

title.children: Lawyers warn of High Court challenge if Tasmanian parliament pushes for judge's suspension

image.altText: The crumpled front of a white BMW SUV, surrounded by emergency services tape.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne court hears a diabetic man whose car struck and killed five people outside a regional Victorian pub allegedly ignored nine warnings from a medical device that his blood glucose levels were low.

title.children: Driver in Daylesford pub crash had more than 30 previous traffic infringements, court hears

image.altText: Kellie stands in front of a blue ute

props.synopsis: Domestic violence support services say they are stretched to the brink and need more resources to keep up with "inventive" abusers who know how to work the system.

title.children: When Kellie's abusive husband died, she realised he'd given away their house and car

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt and black blazer leaves court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's mother, Kelly, tells Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial she noticed a marked change in her daughter around the time of the alleged rape, from having a joy of life to being left a "broken soul".

title.children: 'A mother's worst nightmare': Brittany Higgins's mother gives evidence in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a row of COVID-19 vaccines against a blue background.

props.synopsis: New COVID booster shots are now available in Australia. So who should get one, and will it protect against the virus in time for Christmas?

title.children: What you need to know about the new COVID vaccine available today

image.altText: a group of male students wearing backpacks walk through a uni campus away from the camera. their faces can't be seen

props.synopsis: Tightening of visa processes for migrant workers and international students as the government cracks down on the "broken" migration system in Australia.

title.children: Tightening of visa processes as government cracks down on 'broken' migration system

image.altText: satellite image of cyclone jasper, large weather system off the north queensland coast

props.synopsis: North Queensland residents as far south as Mackay are being warned to brace for damaging winds as Cyclone Jasper continues to track toward the coast.

title.children: BOM issues first tropical cyclone warning with impacts from Jasper expected within 24 hours

image.altText: A woman with black hair wears a grey blazer and looks to the left

props.synopsis: Tasmania's primary industries minister says "nothing is off the table" as the government acts to ensure what she has called distressing images of animal cruelty in a leaked animal rights video does not happen again.

title.children: 'Nothing off the table': Minister warns abattoir industry after 'distressing' slaughter video released

image.altText: Illustration of 45 year old woman struggling to sleep using purple and yellow colour tones.

props.synopsis: Over the next few months, we'll endure heatwaves in different parts of the country. Extreme heat can be life-threatening for some people — and not necessarily the ones you expect.

title.children: How work, a cricket game and even just sitting at home can be catastrophic during a heatwave

image.altText: the premier speaking behind a lecturn

props.synopsis: It's a rare opportunity not granted to all political leaders to control their legacy and quit while on top — and leaving it too late was a risk Annastacia Palaszczuk wasn't going to take.

title.children: Annastacia Palaszczuk's resignation was a bombshell to many, including some of her closest colleagues

image.altText: Shane Tuck looks at a ball that he has thrown in the air at training

props.synopsis: The coroner investigating footballer Shane Tuck's death says the AFL should limit contact training sessions to reduce the risk of concussion.

title.children: Shane Tuck took his own life after receiving repeated head knocks as a footballer and boxer. Now a coroner says the AFL must change

image.altText: A truck and train collided at a level crossing, photographed under cloudy skies.

props.synopsis: A train and a truck have collided at a level crossing in Geelong, south-west of Melbourne. The driver of the truck has died at the scene.

title.children: Truck driver dies after being struck by train at Geelong level crossing

props.synopsis: Need a dose of pop culture and entertainment news? Here are the stories, trailers, memes and more you might've missed.

title.children: Dave Grohl volunteers in Melbourne, SNL takes on Save The Last Dance, and we explain Gag City meme

image.altText: Lana is lying next to her baby. Lana has dark hair and is smiling. The baby has a bilateral cleft palette and is also smiling

props.synopsis: Having a baby with limb and facial difference can be scary for parents as they enter a world unknown to them. But Dave and Lana feel prepared to help their son thrive with his difference, because it's one the whole family shares.

title.children: Being different brought Dave and Lana together and they can't wait to help their son embrace his difference

image.altText: a pile of gold bullion and coins

props.synopsis: It took seven years of expensive, drawn-out legal battles, but one of the oldest and biggest private precious metals companies in Australia closed a dark chapter in the gold refining industry with a recent win against the ATO, writes Adele Ferguson.

title.children: Inside the gold scam that made a fortune — and cost taxpayers millions of dollars

image.altText: Two female children choose from a tin of coloured textas

props.synopsis: The review was carried out following allegations a former Gold Coast childcare worker allegedly abused 91 girls in Brisbane, Sydney and overseas.

title.children: Childcare workers could be banned from using personal phones at work after nationwide review into child safety

image.altText: Boy peeks out of hole between two towels tied together

props.synopsis: The emergency coordinator says the respiratory tract infections are due to "prolonged exposure to cold and rain" as thousands of displaced Palestinians continue to shelter in Rafah.

title.children: 'Every other patient' in Gaza's south has respiratory infection, Médecins Sans Frontières coordinator says – as it happened

image.altText: Close up on a pair of newborn bab

props.synopsis: Expectant Victor Harbor mothers have been told they will need to contact another hospital an hour's drive away, with further concerns for presenting emergency department patients over the busy Christmas period.

title.children: Victor Harbor hospital blames suspension of birthing services on anaesthetist shortage

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large green numbers, showing the price of shares which have risen.

props.synopsis: Shares lose ground during afternoon trade, while a proposed $9 billion mega merger between Chemist Warehouse and Sigma could create a huge ASX-listed pharmacy business. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gives up gains, $9 billion Sigma-Chemist Warehouse merger deal revealed — as it happened

image.altText: A JB Hi-FI sign outside a shop with two people walking past.

props.synopsis: Is an extended warranty worth your money? It's a question being raised in a new class action against retail giant JB Hi-Fi.

title.children: Ever bought an extended warranty? A new lawsuit claims customers have been misled by a major retailer

image.altText: Signage at the entrance to Humpty Doo.

props.synopsis: Police allege the 52-year-old man used a rifle to threaten two people at a property in Darwin's rural area, then shot their two dogs and took the dead animals with him.

title.children: Man who allegedly threatened neighbours, shot their dogs, charged with firearm offences

image.altText: The 250 metre-tall tower in the middle of Noor Energy solar plant.

props.synopsis: This solar thermal plant in the United Arab Emirates could harness enough of the Sun's rays to power a city the size of Brisbane for a year but being able to run one in Australia could prove difficult.

title.children: In the UAE desert, a shining beacon looms large. Experts say it could help Australia go green

image.altText: A row of electric vehicles inside a storage area of a car company.

props.synopsis: With better supply and affordable options, second-hand electric vehicles are set to become more popular in Australia. Here's what you should know before getting one.

title.children: Australia's expected to see 'significant' growth in second-hand EV sales. Here's what to know before getting one

image.altText: A silver car is under parts of a house that was damaged in a tornado.

props.synopsis: Several people are killed, a church collapses and a mobile home lands on top of another as a string of tornadoes hit the US state of Tennessee.

title.children: Several dead, thousands without power after tornadoes strike US

image.altText: A video still showing a teenager, whose face is blurred, being treated by paramedics.

props.synopsis: An investigation into the NSW arrest of a 14-year-old Indigenous boy clears police of excessive force, but raises concerns about accountability and the right to silence.

title.children: Probe clears police of excessive force in arrest that left teen in hospital

image.altText: A man in a navy suit speaks at a lectern.

props.synopsis: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr says his new-look cabinet "better aligns" portfolios and supports his government's 2024 priorities of health, housing, cost of living and infrastructure.

title.children: Andrew Barr reshuffles ACT cabinet to 'refresh' priority portfolios ahead of next year's election

image.altText: Kiana and Ali Rahmani sit with an empty chair between them, with their mother's photo projected on a screen above them

props.synopsis: Narges Mohammadi is being held in the notorious Evin prison in the Iranian capital city of Tehran. Her activism, which continues despite her being behind bars, has now been recognised with a Nobel prize.

title.children: An Iranian women's rights activist won this year's Nobel Peace Prize. She wasn't there to accept it

image.altText: AFP uniformed officers walk through an airport

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police is warning travellers ahead of the holiday season to remain vigilant about an emerging drug mule scam by criminals claiming to be from the United Nations.

title.children: Travellers warned by AFP about fake United Nations drug mule scam

image.altText: A business with a closed sign

props.synopsis: Damaging winds and record rainfall have lashed the state overnight causing road closures, fallen trees and widespread outages — including at two regional hospitals currently running on back up power.

title.children: Wild storm closes roads, hospitals hit by power outages as SA emergency services respond to 900 callouts

image.altText: Daisy Pearce looks to her left while working as a member of Geelong's AFL coaching staff.

props.synopsis: Pearce takes on the challenge of coaching the struggling Eagles in the AFLW, following a decorated playing career highlighted by captaining Melbourne to a premiership.

title.children: Daisy Pearce appointed West Coast Eagles AFLW coach

image.altText: Mansha Arora, Glen Eira student

props.synopsis: Melbourne school leaver Mansha Arora spent her final year of school juggling study with caring for her mother and working to help support her family.

title.children: Melbourne teen who cared for mum during final year of school turns in stellar ATAR result
